hanzi-su-wiki:
紹

Значения

Знакомить, представлять; следовать, преемственность, посредничать, представлять

Мнемоника

Нитки 糸 призваны 召 соединять куски ткани.

Варианты

绍
purpleculture_pinyin:
shào
surname Shao; to continue; to carry on
фамилия Шао; продолжить; продолжать
rtega_mnemonic:
紹紹RS
绍绍		continue, carry on, hand down, to join, to introduce
  • continuous long line 糸 of people holding swords and shouting 召: introduction for a visiting king or president to a country
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 绍)
Pictophonetic: 召 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
紹興 [ shào xīng ]: Shaoxing prefecture level city in Zhejiang
紹興市 [ shào xīng shì ]: Shaoxing prefecture level city in Zhejiang
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 召 [ zhào ] imperial decree; to summon, to call, to beckon
heisig_chinese_memo: Spiderman seduces all the girls he's introduced to. After getting acquainted with them he can summon them back anytime for more fun.
heisig_constituent: introduce, thread, spiderman, summon, seduce, sword, dagger, mouth
koohiiStory1: Spiderman seduces all the girls he´s introduced to.
koohiiStory2: You only get one chance to make a first impression, so make sure you're wearing nice threads when you get introduced to a girl. Otherwise you might have trouble seducing her.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You create a thread with someone by calling out to them to introduce yourself.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You literally call out, and when they turn around, tie a thread to them, so you'll never forget that you introduced yourselves to each other.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You want to introduce yourself to the Shougun (しょう) but no matter how much you call out, he won't come close enough for you to tie your introduction thread to him. You call louder and louder, "SHOUGUN LET ME INTRODUCE MYSELF!"
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Finally the Shougun sighs and turns toward you. You call out your name and get the thread around him. Uh oh. He doesn't look happy.
Ru_Notes:
По большому счёту, в производных одного слова 紹介しょうかい.
Фонетик: 召 (めす、ショウ вызывать, потреблять).
Ru_Words:
紹介しょうかい
  • представление (кого-л. кому-л.)
    • 自己紹介をするじこしょうかいをする
  • отрекомендовываться, называть себя
    • warodai
    紹介状しょうかいじょう
  • рекомендательное письмо
    • warodai
    紹介所しょうかいじょ
  • рекомендательная контора, биржа труда, бюро по устройству браков
    • warodai
    新刊紹介しんかんしょうかい
  • обзор новых книг (изданий), книжное обозрение
    • warodai
    紹介者しょうかいしゃ
  • сущ. рекомендующий, знакомящий, познакомивший, рецензент
    • warodai
Ru_Radicals: 刀 (катана), 口 (рот), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 糸 (нить)
Ru_trainchinese:
shào: (сущ) (сокр.) Шаосин; Шао (фамилия)
shào: (графема) (устар.) продолжать, наследовать (напр., традиции)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you summon (召) the thread (糸) to introduce itself
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Spidey sees the new hot reporter at the newspaper building, summons the boss, and asks the boss to acquaint him with her.
humanum_full_description_en:
The original meaning of " Shao " is inheritance, "Shuowen": "Shao, continue also. Congshi, call sound. One is Shao, tightly correct. Shi, ancient prose Shao from Shao." "Han Shu. "Xu Chuan 2": "Han Shao Yao Yun, to build the emperor's industry." "Shao Fu" means succession and restoration, "Book. "Pangeng Part 1": "The great cause of the king of Shao Fu, Di Sui Quartet."

Bronze inscriptions start with "幺" or "糸", " call ", or add " Jie ", which is the same as the ancient inscriptions of "Shuowen", and the inscriptions are used as family names and names.
humanum_full_description:
「紹」的本義是承繼，《說文》：「紹，繼也。从糸，召聲。一曰紹，緊糾也。綤，古文紹从邵。」《漢書．敘傳下》：「漢紹堯運，以建帝業。」「紹復」表示繼承恢復，《書．盤庚上》：「紹復先王之大業，底綏四方。」

　　金文從「幺」或「糸」，「召」聲，或加從「卩」，與《說文》古文同形，金文用作姓氏和人名。
humanum_short_description: 「紹」從「糸」，「召」聲，本義是繼承，又表示介紹。

①連續，繼承：紹復(繼承恢復)。紹述(繼承)。紹世(連續幾世)。
②指中國浙江省紹興市：紹酒。紹劇。紹興師爺(這一職務舊時大多數由紹興人擔任；後來就稱刀筆吏、訟棍爲“紹興師爺”，含貶義)。

紹介(しょうかい): introduce

「 紹 」的本義是承繼，《說文》：「紹，繼也。从糸，召聲。一曰紹，緊糾也。綤，古文紹从邵。」《漢書．敘傳下》：「漢紹堯運，以建帝業。」「紹復」表示繼承恢復，《書．盤庚上》：「紹復先王之大業，底綏四方。」 金文從「 幺 」或「 糸 」，「 召 」聲，或加從「 卩 」，與《說文》古文同形，金文用作姓氏和人名。
The original meaning of " Shao" is inheritance, "Shuowen": "Shao, continue also. Congshi, call sound. One is Shao, tightly correct. Shi, ancient prose Shao from Shao." "Han Shu. "Xu Chuan 2": "Han Shao Yao Yun, to build the emperor's industry." "Shao Fu" means succession and restoration, "Book. "Pangeng Part 1": "The great cause of the king of Shao Fu, Di Sui Quartet." Bronze inscriptions start with " 幺" or " 糸", " call", or add " Jie", which is the same as the ancient inscriptions of "Shuowen", and the inscriptions are used as family names and names.

紹字的基本解释

紹
shào
见“绍”。

紹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shào］
［《廣韻》市沼切，上小，禪。］
“佋2”的被通假字。亦作“綤1”。“绍1”的繁体字。“詔2”的被通假字。
(1)承继。
(2)介绍。
(3)见“紹繚”。
[②]［chāo］
［《集韻》蚩招切，平宵，昌。］
亦作“綤2”。“绍2”的繁体字。
缓慢。

紹字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　紹； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页920第16
〔古文〕綤【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?市沼切，音佋。【說文】繼也。一曰紹，緊糾也。【書·盤庚】紹復先王之大業。【詩·大雅】弗念厥紹。【禮·樂記】韶繼也。【註】舜樂名也。言舜能繼紹堯之德。　又【禮·聘儀】介紹而傳命。又士爲紹?。【疏】謂繼續承?。【戰國策】請爲紹介。【註】相佐助也。　又姓。【廣韻】出《姓苑》。　又【集韻】蚩招切，音弨。緩也。引《詩》：匪紹匪游。鄭康成讀。

考證：〔【禮·樂記】紹者，繼也〕　謹照原文改韶繼也。

Name meaning
Nothing.
shào
вм. 绍
Radicals: 糸, 召  (thread, call)
Meaning Mnemonic
You create a thread with someone by calling out to them to introduce yourself.
You literally call out, and when they turn around, tie a thread to them, so you'll never forget that you introduced yourselves to each other.
Reading Mnemonic
You want to introduce yourself to the Shougun (しょう) but no matter how much you call out, he won't come close enough for you to tie your introduction thread to him. You call louder and louder, "SHOUGUN LET ME INTRODUCE MYSELF!"
Finally the Shougun sighs and turns toward you. You call out your name and get the thread around him. Uh oh. He doesn't look happy.
